intro: Onagra depressa, commonly known as hoary vervain, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage. The plant produces small, two-lipped flowers that are typically blue to purple in color. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Onagra depressa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by Native American tribes.
